ImmuMicrobiome 0.1.1
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • ImmuMicrobiome_vignette

    Make a constrained reduction on matrices and data.frame.

    plot_constrained_reduction.Rd

    Currently the function supports only the constrained reduction around categorical data. It's not possible yet to give two different Omics datasets to find correlation between them.

    plot_constrained_reduction(
  mat,
  clinical_data,
  axis_x = 1,
  axis_y = 2,
  model,
  nf = 5,
  method = "CCA",
  type = "boxplot",
  group = NULL,
  stat = "none",
  color_vector = c("cyan4", "brown", "deepskyblue", "black", "red"),
  legend_title = NULL,
  lwd = 1,
  conf = 0.9,
  cex = 2,
  font = 2,
  pch = 20,
  draw = "lines",
  ylimits = "auto",
  xlimits = "auto",
  text = F,
  ncol = 1,
  x.intersp = 1,
  y.intersp = 0.5,
  where = "topleft",
  inset = 0.2,
  stat.cex = 2,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    mat

    A numeric matrix with samples as rows

    clinical_data

    An integer specifying the columns that are discrete values.

    axis_x

    Which component for axis x. Default = 1

    axis_y

    Which component for axis y. Default = 2

    model

    Specify here the model to be used for regression

    nf

    Number of components

    method

    The mathematical method to reduce the dimensions. Currently this function supports CCA, RDA and dbRDA

    type

    Chose the type of plot you want, choices are : "boxplot", "pure" or "arrows". Default="boxplot".

    group

    String defining the groups you want to plot on the beta diversity.

    stat

    Either permanova adonis2 with default parameter or envfit function.

    color_vector

    Optionnal. A color vector you wish to use for plotting

    legend_title

    Optionnal. A legend title.

    lwd

    Line width

    conf

    Confidence interval. Default = 0.9.

    cex

    Text size

    font

    Font type

    pch

    Shape type

    draw

    Categorical, draw ellipses as lines or as polygons#'

    ylimits

    Limits for Y axis, if not specified they will be automatically set

    xlimits

    Limits for X axis, if not specified they will be automatically set

    text

    Plot labels or not.

    ncol

    Number of columns for the legend. Default = 1.

    x.intersp

    character interspacing factor for horizontal (x) spacing between symbol and legend text.

    y.intersp

    vertical (y) distances (in lines of text shared above/below each legend entry). A vector with one element for each row of the legend can be used.

    where

    Where you want the permanova result.

    inset

    Permanova legend adjustment see legend

    stat.cex

    Size of the stats text.

    ...

    Value

    A plot rendered using the base package and vegan functions :

    • ordispider

    • ordiellipse

    See also

    plot_reduction() plot_constrained_reduction() beta_dispersion()
